**_Prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, the parties to the Acquisition Agreement or other related_**
**_transaction documents may agree to modify or waive the terms or conditions of the Acquisition Agreement or other_**
**_related documents without noteholder consent._**

Prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, the parties to the Acquisition Agreement or other related
transaction documents may agree to amendments or waivers of the terms thereof. The transaction parties may agree
to make changes to the terms of the Acquisition Agreement or waive certain conditions to the Acquisition Agreement
without obtaining noteholder consent.

**_Unless the AMC Acquisition will be consummated on the issue date of the notes, if the Escrow Release Conditions_**
**_are not satisfied, we will be required to redeem the notes, which means that you may not obtain the return you_**
**_expect on the notes._**

If the issue date of the notes occurs prior to the date that the Acquisition Date, the Issuer will execute and deliver the
Escrow Agreement and the gross proceeds from the offering of the notes will be deposited into the Escrow Account.
The release of Escrowed Property to us to consummate the AMC Acquisition will be subject to the satisfaction of
certain conditions, including the closing of the AMC Acquisition substantially concurrently with or promptly
following the release of such Escrowed Property. The consummation of the AMC Acquisition is subject to customary
closing conditions, including regulatory conditions. As of the date of this offering memorandum, the regulatory
conditions in the Acquisition Agreement have been satisfied. If (i) the closing of the AMC Acquisition has not
occurred on or prior to the Outside Date, (ii) we notify the Trustee in writing prior to the Outside Date that we will
not pursue the consummation of the AMC Acquisition or (iii) the Acquisition Agreement has been terminated prior
to the Outside Date without the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, we will be required to redeem all of the
outstanding notes at a redemption price equal to 100% of the outstanding principal amount thereof, plus accrued and
unpaid interest, if any, from and including the issue date of the notes, or the most recent date to which interest has
been paid on the notes, whichever is later, to, but not including, the special mandatory redemption date. The Escrow
Account will not include cash to fund any accrued and unpaid interest owing to holders of the notes, which is included
in the special mandatory redemption price. In the event that the special mandatory price payable upon such special
mandatory redemption for the notes exceeds the amount of the applicable Escrowed Property, we will be required to
fund the difference between the applicable special mandatory redemption price and the amount of the Escrowed
Property pursuant to a commitment provided by us. We may not have sufficient funds to ensure such redemption price
is paid in full on the date of redemption.

Upon such special mandatory redemption, you may not be able to reinvest the proceeds from the redemption in an
investment that yields comparable returns to those of the notes. Additionally, you may suffer a loss on your investment
if you purchase the notes at a price greater than the issue price of the notes. You will have no rights under the special
mandatory redemption provisions as long as the AMC Acquisition is consummated on or on or before the Outside
Date, unless the AMC Acquisition is terminated earlier. You will not have any right to require us to repurchase your
notes if, between the closing of this offering and the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, we experience any
changes (including any material changes) in our business or financial condition, or if the terms of the AMC Acquisition
change, including in material respects. See “Description of Notes—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory
Redemption.”

**_In a bankruptcy proceeding, the holders of notes might not be able to apply the Escrowed Property to repay the_**
**_notes without bankruptcy court approval._**

If we commence a bankruptcy or reorganization case, or one is commenced against us, while the Escrow Account
remains funded, applicable bankruptcy laws may prevent the Trustee under the indenture that will govern the notes
from using the Escrowed Property to pay the special mandatory redemption. The court adjudicating that case might
find that the Escrow Account and the Escrowed Property are the property of the bankruptcy estate. Although the
amounts in the Escrow Account will be pledged as security for the notes during the term of the escrow, the automatic
stay provisions of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or other applicable bankruptcy laws generally prohibit (or at a minimum
delay) secured creditors from foreclosing upon or disposing of a debtor’s property without prior bankruptcy court
approval (which may not be given under the facts and circumstances or could be materially delayed). As a result,
holders of the notes may not be able to have the funds in the Escrow Account applied at the time or in the manner
contemplated by the indenture that will govern the notes and could suffer a loss as a result. If the court adjudicating


-----

that case finds that the Escrow Account and Escrowed Property are the property of the bankruptcy estate, the court
could authorize the use of such funds by the bankruptcy estate or the bankruptcy trustee, if one is appointed, with or
without restrictions. As a result, the holders of the notes could become unsecured creditors of the bankruptcy estate or
could be forced to accept less liquid or saleable collateral in exchange for the Escrowed Property as adequate protection
or otherwise. In such event, the only remedy available to the holders of the notes would be to sue for payment on the
notes.

**_Between the time of the issuance of the notes and the completion of the AMC Acquisition, the parties to the_**
**_Acquisition Agreement or other related transaction documents may agree to modify or waive the terms or conditions_**
**_of the Acquisition Agreement or other related documents without noteholder consent._**

Prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition, the parties to the Acquisition Agreement or other related
transaction documents may agree to amendments or waivers of the terms thereof. The Escrow Agreement will provide
as a condition to the release of the Escrowed Property that we certify that the AMC Acquisition is expected to be
completed substantially concurrently with or promptly following the release of the funds in the Escrow Account. The
transaction parties may agree to make changes to the terms of the Acquisition Agreement or waive certain conditions
to the Acquisition Agreement without obtaining noteholder consent.

**Risks Related to the Notes**

**_We will have substantial indebtedness and may incur additional debt in the future, including secured debt, which_**
**_could substantially reduce our profitability, limit our ability to pursue certain business opportunities and prevent_**
**_us from fulfilling our obligations under the notes._**

As of December 31, 2023, after giving pro forma effect to the Transactions, we would have had approximately $4,634
million of total indebtedness (including the notes offered hereby), and the ability to incur an additional $374 million
under the Extended First Lien Revolving Credit Facility (after giving effect to letters of credit issued thereunder). This
debt requires us to make significant interest and principal payments. Subject to certain limitations set forth in the credit
agreement or (if the USD Incremental Term Loan Facility is incurred in the form of a side car term loan facility) credit
agreements, that governs or will govern, as applicable, the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, the indenture governing

offered hereby, which, if not cured or waived could result in our being required to repay these borrowings before their

**_We may be unable to service our indebtedness, including the notes._**

Our ability to make scheduled payments on and to refinance our indebtedness, including the notes, depends on and is
subject to our financial and operating performance, which in turn is affected by general and regional economic,
financial, competitive, business and other factors and reimbursement actions of governmental and commercial payers,
all of which are beyond our control, including the availability of financing in the international banking and capital
markets. Lower net revenues before provision for doubtful accounts, or higher provision for uncollectibles, generally
will reduce our cash flow. We cannot assure you that our business will generate sufficient cash flow from operations,
that currently anticipated cost savings and operating improvements will be realized or that future borrowings will be
available to us in an amount sufficient to enable us to service our debt, including the notes, to refinance our debt or to
fund our other liquidity needs.

If our cash flows and capital resources are insufficient to fund our debt service obligations, we may be forced to reduce
or delay capital expenditures, including those for integrating our historical acquisitions or for future corporate
development activities. We also may be forced to sell assets or operations, seek additional capital, or restructure or
refinance our indebtedness. We cannot assure you that we would be able to take any of these actions, that these actions
would be successful and permit us to meet our scheduled debt service obligations, or that these actions would be
permitted under the terms of our existing or future debt agreements, including the credit agreement or (if the USD
Incremental Term Loan Facility is incurred in the form of a side car term loan facility) credit agreements, that governs
or will govern, as applicable, the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, the indenture governing the Existing Notes and the
indenture governing the notes.

Any restructuring or refinancing of all or a portion of our debt, including the notes, could cause us to default on our
debt obligations and impair our liquidity. Our ability to restructure or refinance our debt will depend on the condition
of the capital markets and our financial condition at such time. In addition, any failure to make scheduled payments
of interest and principal on outstanding indebtedness would likely result in a reduction of our credit rating, which
could harm our ability to access additional capital on commercially reasonable terms or at all. Any refinancing of our
indebtedness could be at higher interest rates and may require us to comply with more onerous covenants that could
further restrict our business operations.

Moreover, in the event of a default, the holders of our indebtedness, including the notes, could elect to declare all the
funds borrowed to be due and payable, together with accrued and unpaid interest, if any. If we breach our covenants
under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, we would be in default thereunder. The lenders could exercise their rights,
as described above, and we could be forced into bankruptcy or liquidation. All of these events could result in your
losing your investment in the notes.

**_Our variable rate debt subjects us to interest rate risk, which could cause our debt service obligations to increase_**
**_significantly and potentially limit our ability to effectively refinance our indebtedness as it matures._**

Our debt outstanding under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities bear interest at variable rates and expose us to interest
rate risk. Reference rates used to determine the applicable interest rates for our variable rate debt began to rise
significantly in 2022 and 2023, and these increases may continue, or such increased rates may not be decreased
materially or at all, in 2024 and beyond. If interest rates continue to increase or remain high, our debt service


-----

obligations on the variable rate indebtedness will increase or remain high even though the amount borrowed will
remain the same, which will negatively impact our profitability and cash flows, including cash available for servicing
our indebtedness. As of December 31, 2023, on an as adjusted basis after giving effect to the Financing Transactions,
a 0.125% increase or decrease in interest rates on our variable rate debt, assuming our Extended First Lien Revolving
Credit Facility is fully drawn and without giving effect to interest rate swaps and caps, would result in an increase or
decrease, as applicable of our total interest expense of $4.3 million. Additionally, higher interest rate will affect our
ability to refinance portions of our indebtedness in advance of their maturity dates on terms that we deem attractive.

In order to manage our exposure to interest rate risk and add stability to interest expense movements, we have
historically entered into derivative financial instruments, typically interest rate swaps and caps, involving the exchange
of variable for fixed rate interest payments. However, certain of those interest rate swaps and caps have expired or
will expire in the near term. New interest rate caps and the replacement of our expiring interest rate caps may be more
expensive as a result of increasing interest rates. There can be no assurance that any such derivative financial
instruments will have the desired beneficial impact or that we will be able to purchase additional interest rate caps or
similar or other derivatives in the future on a cost-effective basis or at all. If we are unable to enter into such derivative
financial instruments, or achieve favorable terms in such derivative financial instruments, in the future, it may
adversely affect our cash flow and may impact our ability to make required principal and interest payments on our
indebtedness and, even if we use these instruments to selectively manage risks, there can be no assurance that we will
be fully protected against material interest rate fluctuations.

**_We may have future capital needs and may not be able to obtain additional financing on acceptable terms, or at_**
**_all._**

We may in the future need debt financing to fund our operations, capital expenditures and expansion. The market
conditions and the macroeconomic conditions that affect the markets in which we operate could adversely affect our
ability to secure financing on acceptable terms, if at all. We may be unable to secure additional financing on favorable
terms or at all and our operating cash flow may be insufficient to satisfy our financial obligations under the
indebtedness outstanding from time to time. The terms of additional financing may limit our financial and operating
flexibility. Our ability to satisfy our financial obligations will depend upon our future operating performance, the
availability of credit generally, economic conditions and financial, business and other factors, many of which are
beyond our control. Furthermore, if financing is not available when needed, or is not available on acceptable terms,
we may be unable to take advantage of business opportunities or respond to competitive pressures, any of which could
materially and adversely affect our prospects, business, financial condition, results of operations and cash flows.

**_Our failure to comply with the agreements relating to our outstanding indebtedness, including as a result of events_**
**_beyond our control, could result in an event of default that could materially and adversely affect our prospects,_**
**_business, financial condition, results of operations and cash flows._**

If there were an event of default under any of the agreements relating to our outstanding indebtedness, the holders of
the defaulted debt could cause all amounts outstanding with respect to that debt to be due and payable immediately.
We cannot assure you that our assets or cash flows would be sufficient to fully repay borrowings under our outstanding
debt instruments if accelerated upon an event of default. In addition, any event of default or declaration of acceleration
under one debt instrument could also result in an event of default under one or more of our other debt instruments.

**_Claims of holders of the notes will be structurally subordinated to claims of creditors of certain of our subsidiaries_**
**_that will not guarantee the notes._**

The notes will be guaranteed by certain of our existing and future subsidiaries. Claims of holders of the notes will be
structurally subordinated to the claims of creditors of these non–guarantor subsidiaries, including trade creditors, and
will not be satisfied from the assets of these non–guarantor subsidiaries until their creditors are paid in full.

The indenture that will govern the notes offered hereby will permit these non-guarantor subsidiaries to incur certain
additional debt and will not limit their ability to incur other liabilities that are not considered indebtedness thereunder.
