**OUR BUSINESS**

**Our Company**

Rocket is a leading global enterprise software provider with a broad portfolio of products that help corporations,
government agencies, and other organizations run their mission-critical IT operations. We enable small and large
enterprises in many industries to maximize their data, systems and infrastructure to deliver critical services that power
our modern world. Our software runs, optimizes and protects our customers’ applications, servers and databases, and
integrates these core platforms with the rest of the enterprise, while providing a full-stack of modernization solutions.
Our products enable customers to carry out their most mission-critical business functions, such as processing payment
transactions at global financial institutions and maintaining healthcare records at hospitals and insurance companies.

Since our founding over 30 years ago, we have cultivated a customer-centric culture with strategic investments in
R&D that provide a wide range of solutions to meet customers’ evolving needs. We have evolved from solely
maintaining legacy infrastructure to facilitating modernization journeys to connect mainframe to the hybrid cloud
environment. We have accomplished this evolution through substantial R&D efforts, highlighted by over $500 million
in investments into R&D since 2020, as well as multiple acquisitions that have expanded our modernization offering.

Given our focus on supporting our customers’ mission-critical business functions, our products address deeply
embedded technologies that sit at the core of enterprise IT infrastructure. These systems have evolved over multiple
decades and, particularly for our largest customers, represent billions of dollars of cumulative custom application
development and IT infrastructure investment. As enterprises look to the future, hybrid remains vital to enabling the
deployment of cloud environments as it incorporates client server computing, cloud-based platforms, and modern
connectivity and portability.

We seek to enable our customers to experience the best of both the cloud and the mainframe, putting relevant
workloads in the cloud while leveraging the mainframe for its best features – security, reliability, and governance.
Our strategy is to modernize without disruption, meeting customers where they are in their modernization journey. By
utilizing our product portfolio, customers can modernize effectively, even incrementally, integrating new technologies
while preserving and leveraging the robust foundation already in place for a seamless technological evolution. We
believe this approach dramatically lowers risk and improves success rates of IT system modernization projects.

As the pace of digital transformation continues to accelerate, we believe our customers will increasingly look to us to
extract greater value from existing IT systems and applications through innovation, integration, optimization and
modernization.

Today, Rocket is organized into three main business units focused on Infrastructure Modernization, Data
Modernization and Application Modernization. While each business unit has its own technical requirements and
products, we go to market using a holistic approach to solving our customers’ problems, utilizing solutions across our
business units to help drive operating efficiencies among overlapping buying centers to best position us to drive future
growth. These business units are as follows:

_Infrastructure Modernization: Our Infrastructure Modernization business unit represents approximately_
55% of our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It comprises software solutions built
for integrating and optimizing mainframe workloads, mitigating security and compliance risks and
optimizing storage. Organizations can leverage our range of solutions to support mainframe security and
compliance in the face of new threats and deliver optimized mainframe performance management and
interoperability. The mainframe continues to be an integral part of modern-day IT infrastructure and
provides a reliable architecture for high-volume data processing and transactions. Mainframes provide a
level of five 9s of availability (99.999%), which is several orders of magnitude higher than alternative
distributed servers, making mainframes the optimal platform for mission-critical processes. Additionally,
mainframes are uniquely engineered to process millions of input and output calculations per second, which
is a key difference from distributed servers that are designed to be more general purpose, limiting their
ability to perform a specialized task extremely well. Consequently, mainframes provide a range of
advantages over distributed systems that are likely to persist, and we believe organizations in regulated and


-----

data intensive industries will continue to rely on mainframe systems to process high-volume, missioncritical activity at the core of their IT infrastructures.

_Data Modernization: Our Data Modernization business unit represents approximately 18% of our_
standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It provides software solutions to connect
mission-critical data residing on the mainframe and distributed systems to advanced applications and
compute workloads running on private and public cloud environments. As organizations increasingly adopt
a hybrid cloud infrastructure approach to operations, effectively navigating the complexities of data
governance and compliance while maximizing data utilization is critical. Our solutions address this
challenge by eliminating data siloes to enhance decision-making and customer experience while maintaining
strong data governance, security, scalability and dynamic availability. For example, one of our key products,
Mobius, enables customers to integrate seamlessly with third-party repositories, facilitating secure and
efficient data movement between modern and legacy systems. Our track record of successfully integrating
acquisitions within this business unit highlights our commitment to providing an end-to-end offering that
reframes customer engagement strategies and paves the way for future growth.

_Application Modernization: Our Application Modernization business unit represents the remaining 27% of_
our standalone revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. It is comprised of a portfolio of solutions
aimed at improving application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating
modern workflows for legacy applications. While Application Modernization covers both distributed offmainframe platforms and mainframe environments, many of the most important back-end applications for
large enterprises still reside on the mainframe and have yet to be modernized. With key offerings including
database management, DevOps, and low-code application development platforms, we enable organizations
to efficiently deliver reliable, scalable and secure applications to support their core business needs. One of
our key innovations has been to enable enterprise adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid
cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern development practices even for legacy systems.

Across these three business units, we serve over 12,500 end-user customers, pro forma for the AMC Acquisition. Our
customer base spans every major industry vertical and includes some of the largest companies in the world, including
43 of the Fortune 50, as of 2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition). Our customer base is highly
diversified with the top ten Rocket-led customers representing just 14% of revenue in the year ended December 31,
2023 (excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition).

In addition to these deeply embedded and long-term customer relationships, we have also cultivated a number of
partnerships that are critical to our business. Our largest partnership is with IBM. We generate approximately 23% of
our revenue through IBM-led sales. Through a series of organic R&D investments, acquisitions, joint development
efforts and a strong GTM partnership, we have become one of IBM’s most trusted software partners. This partnership
has evolved over 30 years and is driven primarily by our expertise in mainframe and mid-range servers of which IBM
is a major manufacturer. Our software enhances and creates efficiencies for IBM’s customers and extends the life of
IBM’s core platforms. In partnership with IBM, we develop and support core software offerings in their portfolio,
freeing IBM to redirect their R&D spend to other areas. As part of our partnership with IBM, numerous Rocket
products are re-branded as IBM products and sold through their global salesforce.

While we are committed to remaining a high-quality business partner to IBM and extending the lifetime value of core
IBM-led products, we are working to increase the share of Rocket-led sales to further diversify our revenue. Our
Rocket-led GTM strategy, whether executed directly or through our channel partners, allows us to provide best-inclass support to our customers in managing their mainframe and modernization journey, particularly as they move
towards a hybrid cloud environment.

We are headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts and maintain a large global footprint with significant operations in
North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia and Australia. As of December 31, 2023 we had 2,200 employees
(excluding the impact of the AMC Acquisition) worldwide with a presence in 13 global offices. Following the AMC
Acquisition, we expect to have approximately 3,000 Rocketeers and 20 global offices. This worldwide coverage
provides us with access to economies of scale, lower cost offshore operations, high-growth emerging markets and
global support for our increasingly global customer base.


-----

**Acquisition of Application Modernization and Connectivity**

On November 28, 2023, we entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the AMC business of OpenText, which
includes historically a product group of Micro Focus and, beginning February 1, 2023, the OT Connectivity business,
a product group of OpenText, for an all-cash purchase price of $2.275 billion, before taxes, fees and other adjustments.
For more information, see “Summary––The AMC Acquisition.”

The AMC business has been a leader in application modernization for many years with a focus on mainframe
replatforming solutions that help with the migration and operation of mainframe workloads to distributed and cloud
environments. For the year ended December 31, 2023, the AMC business generated Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue
of $504 million and Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA of $307 million. AMC Non-GAAP Adjusted Revenue is
comprised of (x) for the year ended December 31, 2022, approximately $355 million of ARR, $108 million of
perpetual license revenue and $13 million of professional service revenue, and (y) for the year ended December 31,
2023, approximately $364 million of ARR, $121 million of perpetual license revenue and $20 million of professional
services revenue. The AMC business operates within five portfolio segments that form a comprehensive suite for
mainframe application development, maintenance and modernization:

_Enterprise Suite: The AMC business’s Enterprise Suite business unit represents approximately 18% of its_
revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution is the AMC business’s fastest growing product
line, providing end-to-end mainframe workload migration tools including migration analysis, test and
deployment tools and an enterprise server that emulates the mainframe environment in the cloud. The
Enterprise Suite helps organizations move mainframe workloads to run on distributed environments with a
significantly lower degree of code change relative to other complex migration options like refactoring.
Within the Enterprise Suite, four core tools address different stages of workload migration and application
development. The Analyzer, Developer and Enterprise Test Server are focused on delivering diagnostic
tools, modern IDE and virtual test environments. The Enterprise Server provides a multi-platform
production environment to replatform IBM z/OS applications. The revenue derived from Enterprise Server
is highly recurring in nature and allows for an emulated mainframe on cloud environments with the ability
to run mission-critical applications.

_COBOL: The AMC business’s COBOL business unit represents approximately 36% of its revenue for the_
year ended December 31, 2023. This solution enables organizations to develop, maintain and deploy
COBOL based applications across the enterprise using modern DevOps tools and platforms. COBOL is a
legacy programming language that is integral to the majority of mission-critical applications. As most
developers lack experience working in COBOL, a modern set of DevOps tools enables enterprises to
modernize and update their most important applications. The AMC business’s tools provide an IDE for
analyzing and editing COBOL in applications primarily off-mainframe, providing developers with
visualizations and coding environments similar to modern IDEs. As one indicator of the AMC business’s
market position, the AMC business is the only official COBOL compiler available on CSPs marketplaces.

_Host Connectivity: The AMC business’s Host Connectivity business unit represents approximately 32% of_
its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This solution includes mainframe terminal emulators and
plugins for application access, process automation and security solutions. Customer use cases include
providing flexible access to mission-critical applications running on mainframe environments via modern,
distributed systems (desktop, web and mobile) in a secure and compliant manner (i.e. multi factor
authentication). The AMC business’s Host Connectivity tools provide a broad number of options that allow
for significant customization to deliver strong, auditable and compliant security that meets organizations’
requirements.

_Mainframe Application Development Life Cycle Management: The AMC business’s Mainframe ADLM_
business unit represents approximately 11% of its revenue for the year ended December 31, 2023. This
solution provides mainframe source code change, configuration and management enabling organizations to
modernize and integrate mainframes across new technologies and platforms. This results in shorter app
delivery cycles, stronger security and increased productivity. Customer use cases include version control
functionality to track changes made to source code (i.e. ChangeMan ZMF), change management workflow,
release management and automation, automated testing, auditing and reporting.


-----

_CORBA: The AMC business’s COBRA business unit represents approximately 3% of its revenue for the_
year ended December 31, 2023. This solution provides middleware for communication across distributed
applications. CORBA add-on solutions enable any CORBA application to take advantage of new
deployment models, including cloud, containers and virtual environments or to extend and re-use existing
CORBA resources without prior knowledge of CORBA technology. These solutions are used in
telecommunications for managing network elements and the integration of different vendor equipment, in
military and defense for building command and control systems and in finance for trading and risk
management systems.

The AMC Acquisition represents a highly complementary addition to our product portfolio, with the AMC business
expected to further build out a more diverse modernization portfolio that aligns with customer demands and allows us
to meet our customers wherever they are on their modernization journey. The AMC Acquisition is expected to achieve
key strategic objectives, including:

  - Expanding the product portfolio with a stronger, more comprehensive modernization offering that is able to
meet customers at any stage of their IT modernization journey, whether modernizing in place, migrating
select workloads to hybrid environments or replatforming;

  - Providing a full-stack of products and solutions to enable end-to-end modernization without the disruption
of existing workflows and allow customers to derive value from their decades of investment in core
applications;

  - Expanding customer reach through deeper and broader customer engagement across Fortune 2000 accounts
for greater retention and cross-selling. A more comprehensive and complete offering solidifies Rocket as the
strategic partner of choice to address customer needs, tapping into developer-led decisions and guiding
customers through their modernization journey over time, ultimately expanding Rocket’s relevance;

  - Tapping into CSP budget pools through the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities, augmenting our
existing hybrid cloud solutions suite and expanding our footprint with CSPs including Google Cloud
Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure as preferred replatforming partners;

  - Expanding our global reach, with a stronger presence in EMEA, Asia Pacific, and Latin American channels,
thus diversifying our revenue sources and redistributing geographic concentrations; and

  - Combining R&D engines to drive increased innovation, better modernization capabilities and more elegant
solutions to further accelerate a shifty to hybrid cloud technology. The AMC business’s additional resources
for innovation will foster continuous R&D innovation through the application of emerging technologies like
generative artificial intelligence.

Acquiring the AMC business’s replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs, including Google Cloud
Platform, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure, is expected to enable us to tap into new budget pools and
augment our existing hybrid cloud solutions suite. Rocket has broken down the boundaries of on-premises and cloud
computing so that businesses can connect IT systems and modern applications. The seamless data flow, data
integration and continuous enhancements create benefits like streamlined processes, improved efficiencies, and better
return on investment so that customers can be more dynamic, secure, and agile in the face of an increasingly complex
IT and business environment. Access to the AMC business’s additional software developers will drive increased
innovation and development of better solutions to accelerate a shift to a hybrid cloud environment, reinforcing our
commitment to our customer-centric R&D efforts. This move is expected to further strengthen our position as the
partner of choice for mission-critical IT modernization.

**Our GTM Strategy**

Our marketing and GTM strategies are driven, first and foremost, to deliver the right solutions to customers, regardless
of channel. To that end, our sales and marketing efforts are bifurcated between our Rocket-led products and our IBMled products, each of which have their own strategies.


-----

Our Rocket-led products are sold through two primary avenues: (1) direct to customer through our centralized
customer success, support and delivery teams and (2) channel partners.

  - Our direct sales force and marketing investment, which is focused on Rocket-led solutions, is shifting the
dialogue from mainframe buying centers to a CIO and CPO strategy covering the expanse of Rocket use
cases. We rely on marketing to drive brand awareness, generate leads across our growth product areas and
support subscription and maintenance renewals by reinforcing the value delivered by our new releases and
product innovation. Through our 30-year operating history and over 50 acquisitions, we have a strong base
of customers that we continually look to serve with our growing portfolio of solutions. Our sales force targets
both existing customers and new logo opportunities and is comprised of a global set of enterprise sales
professionals focused on account relationships. Our enterprise sales professionals are product specialists who
focus on selling our solutions with our solutions engineers providing technical guidance to customers
throughout the sales process. This team handles new sales as well as up-sells and cross-sells within existing
accounts, further driving revenue expansion. Renewals of existing maintenance contracts and subscriptions
are handled by our centralized renewal team, who have helped to drive our consistently high renewal rates.

  - In addition to our direct sales force, our Rocket-led sales organization also leads our strategic alliances. Our
10 strategic channel partner relationships consist of resellers, distributors and systems integrators who embed
our solutions in other software applications and help to deliver new solutions to market. Our strong
relationships with Independent ISVs and MSPs enable us to better reach both current and potential customers,
and these strong MSP relationships also support customers using MSPs to manage their mainframe.

For our IBM-led products, we have a dedicated sales enablement team across the IBM OEM product segments, all
backed by a 30-year longstanding partnership driving us and IBM to partner on opportunities and deployments. These
joint Rocket-IBM sales and marketing initiatives allow us to drive demand, refine messaging, enable sales and
strengthen win rates for our IBM-led products, which continue to have strong retention rates supported by the strength
of our partnership with IBM. In addition to benefits that we realize from the partnership, IBM also leverages us to
support the broader mainframe industry and expand value delivered from incumbent involvement.

Ultimately, our powerful GTM strategy is bolstered by a centralized customer success and support effort with global
coverage, a dedicated team focused on renewals and driving upsell and cross-sell opportunities across the installed
base, numerous strategic alliances that help market and distribute our solutions and a robust partnership with IBM.
The combination of these factors forms our strong customer success engine and continues to help us drive strong
retention rates.

We have further built our business to serve the expanding needs of our customers and address growing budget pools
that are focused on digital transformation. We’ve transitioned from a focus on providing solutions to the head of
infrastructure to addressing a head of applications or a Chief Data Officer who is focused on driving revenue
generation of their business. Whether it is the CIO or the Chief Data Officer, we have solutions that address their
mission-critical challenges and our GTM approach ensures that we serve the different needs of our expanded buyer
set. The combined forces of Rocket and the AMC business are expected to create a broader product offering that
serves the entire modernization continuum, all in a single partner.

As one example of how the AMC Acquisition will help broaden our product offering and modernization capabilities,
we expect the AMC business to provide us with additional GTM channels to tap into CSP budget pools given the
AMC business’s strength in replatforming capabilities and strong relationships with CSPs. We believe this will further
elevate Rocket’s status with MSPs, CSPs and other key ecosystem participants, further strengthening and
differentiating our GTM strategy.

**Our Competitive Strengths**

_Deep and Embedded Portfolio of Solutions Meets Customer Needs Across Environments_


-----

Since our founding, we have focused strategically on innovation to develop and enhance our software solutions to
consistently meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our portfolio of solutions represents a full-stack of purpose-built
products tailored to various end markets. Within each of these environments, we address customer pain points at every
layer of their IT system. This ranges from the core IT infrastructure (i.e. software tooling for the mainframe itself or
an embedded database) to newly developed applications that are open source in nature and run in the cloud but need
to integrate with the more traditional components of a customer’s IT system. In delivering this comprehensive portfolio
of products, we focus on opportunities categorized within our three synergistic business lines: Infrastructure
Modernization, Data Modernization and Application Modernization. We expect the AMC Acquisition to bring a suite
of tools with a focus on mainframe modernization and replatforming that help with the migration of critical mainframe
workloads to distributed and cloud environments. The AMC Acquisition is expected to broaden our existing product
portfolio with complementary modernization solutions and an increased focus on enabling migration to the cloud.

Illustrative use cases that enable customers throughout their modernization journey include but are not limited to:

  - Creating modern platforms and tools that are faster, cheaper and lower risk than replacing incumbent systems
to modernize;

  - Providing a toolset for mainframe replatforming and management of critical mainframe migration workloads;

  - Providing the tools for modern, compliant, and agile developer experiences;

  - Managing and operating core IT infrastructure more efficiently without forcing disruptive re-platforming;

  - Connecting legacy systems with cloud infrastructure; and

  - Managing accelerating data growth and provide real-time access for AI, ML, data and analytics.

By focusing on providing a full-stack solution to these deeply embedded technologies and environments, we believe
we have established ourselves as a highly valued and differentiated provider to our customers and partners.
_Long-Term, Blue-Chip Customers Rely on Rocket to Modernize Mission-Critical Applications_

Over our 30-year history we have created and developed deeply embedded relationships with a wide array of
customers ranging from small and mid-market businesses to governments and the largest enterprises in the world.
Following the AMC Acquisition, we expect to serve over 12,500 end-user customers across a broad range of industries
with particular strength in financial services, aerospace and defense, automotive manufacturing, retail, government
and healthcare. Our customer base also includes governments, major telecommunications companies, educational
institutions, retailers and other institutions, as well as channel partners including IT outsourcing providers, distributors
and systems integrators. Our strong presence in numerous industry verticals helps to diversify our revenue base, and
the mission-critical nature of our products mitigates the risk of industry-specific and cyclical downturns. Our
customers include 86% of the Fortune 50, as of 2023. 28 of the top 30 Fortune 50 companies trust and use Rocket, as
well as all top 10 commercial banks.


-----

We expect the AMC Acquisition to bring approximately 5,000 global blue chip customer accounts with significant
overlap to Rocket’s existing customer base, diversifying our revenue sources and geographic reach with a stronger
presence in EMEA, Asia Pacific, and Latin American channels while retaining a core revenue base in North America.

_Customer-Centric R&D Drives Value Proposition and Customer Stickiness_

With nearly 1,900 Rocketeer Engineers (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition) and an R&D presence in five continents,
we are committed to developing and maintaining a strong R&D organization. This commitment has enabled us to
continuously adapt to and meet our customers’ evolving needs by enhancing our existing products and developing
new ones. Our customer-first approach to development has driven a customer satisfaction score of 94% for 2023.

We created our business units to help organize R&D by underlying system type and technology themes to better align
with our customers’ needs and increase accountability and ownership of results. As a result, we develop a granular
view on key R&D investment strategies that minimize cost overruns or delays and have a targeted R&D strategy to


-----

better serve key customers and channel partners. As a global research organization, we also have access to a wide and
deep pool of talent across both high-cost and low-cost centers to drive efficiencies.

The strength of our R&D efforts has translated into competitive wins in the market. For example, the largest Italian
postal group, a long-term Rocket Mobius customer, upgraded its existing content management system (Mobius) that
enabled the use of Mobius with their Amazon Web Services platform, benefitting from Rocket’s investments in hybrid
cloud enablement and API integrations. Our efforts in improving UI and UX in application modernization products
provided a leading global provider of financial market infrastructure services with a better sign-in experience for
clients which was previously a key pain point. Our customer-centric R&D approach enhances our value proposition
and drives customer stickiness.

The acquisition reinforces and magnifies Rocket’s commitment to innovation and R&D, incorporating cloud, AI and
ML alongside the company’s decades-long development and track record in mission-critical systems.

_Diversified, End-to-End Modernization Platform Supporting Full-Stack Modernization_

Our Infrastructure Modernization, Application Modernization and Data Modernization business units form one suite
of solutions that enables customers to modernize end-to-end across their IT systems and support a transition to a hybrid
cloud environment. This shift in focus towards a full-stack of modernization solutions has provided us access to
multiple growing budget pools. In 2018, 44% of our GTM motion was Rocket-led with the remainder being IBM-led.
As of 2023 (pro forma for the AMC Acquisition), approximately 77% of our GTM motion is Rocket-led representing
our evolved strategy whereby the significant majority of our GTM motion is Rocket-led.

With an emphasized focus on supporting full-stack modernization, we have been able to tap into multiple budget pools
expanding beyond legacy infrastructure spend and into evergreen budgets focused on digital transformation. These
budget pools are controlled by several buying centers across an organization including the Chief Information Officer,
Chief Data Officer, Head of Applications, Chief Information Security Officer and Head of Infrastructure, all of whom
are focused on full-stack modernization. With the addition of the AMC business, we’re also increasing our exposure
with developers, who are often key decision makers within DevOps budget pools for application modernization.


-----

With the AMC business’s capabilities, we expect to deliver full-stack modernization solutions that vastly expand the
value our customers get out of their systems and their core data thereby augmenting our customers’ ability to deliver
hybrid solutions that enable new customer experiences.

_Predictable, High Visibility Revenue Model_

We derive the majority of our revenues from subscriptions and maintenance, which, in conjunction with our strong
historical renewal and retention rates, have provided a steady and visible revenue stream. For the year ended December
31, 2023, recurring revenue accounted for approximately 76% of our total revenues. Our software solutions are
mission-critical and deeply embedded within the IT infrastructure, which results in high switching costs given the
disruptive, time-consuming and resource-intensive nature of new enterprise software installations. Many of our
products have been embedded in customers’ IT infrastructures for over a decade, making our products expensive and
risky to replace. Furthermore, our significant domain expertise enables a high level of end-user customization, further
entrenching our solutions within our customers’ business processes. Our historical gross and net revenue retention
have averaged 93% and 102%, respectively since 2022.

contributes a wide array of experiences at multiple industry-leading technology and software companies, providing
valuable insights and skills that help to run our business. Over the last four years, we have enhanced our management
team through the recruitment of not only new Chief Executive, Financial, Marketing, Revenue, Information, People

**Our Strategy**

_Embrace Hybrid Cloud to Enable Enterprises to Unlock New Capabilities and Growth Opportunities and_
_Simultaneously Optimize Mission-Critical Systems_

Through our strategy of enabling enterprises to embrace and innovate with hybrid cloud, companies can deploy,
execute and manage workloads, applications and data agnostic of their chosen infrastructure in a seamless and
transparent manner from mainframe to cloud. This approach allows enterprises to not only maximize the full potential
and value of their data stored on mainframe, but also leverage that data to drive decisions and insights from cloudnative capabilities, including AI, ML and advanced analytics. One of our key innovations has been to enable enterprise
adoption of unified DevOps across mainframe and hybrid cloud architectures, which enables teams to deploy modern
development practices even for legacy systems and which we expect the AMC Acquisition to further enhance. This
will empower our customers as they pursue their modernization journeys, and we are right there with them. Ultimately,
this narrative aligns the technology investments made by enterprises with their key business outcomes, providing
customers with a complete lifecycle of solutions and letting them focus on business without worrying about the
constraints of their current technology architecture.

_Focus on R&D and Investment in Product Portfolio_

Since 2020, we have invested $521 million in R&D initiatives. With nearly 1,900 Rocketeer Engineers (pro forma for
the AMC Acquisition) and an R&D presence in five continents, our R&D investment is the cornerstone of our ability
to innovate, enabling us to better address customer needs, retain existing accounts and attract new business. It also
allows us to provide full-stack solutions to our customers, which we believe, in conjunction with our powerful GTM
team and strategy, will ultimately drive strong retention rates among our installed bases. Our customer-centric R&D
shows our true understanding of the different needs of our customers and buyers who are looking to modernize their
infrastructure, reinforcing, and magnifying our commitment to innovation. Additionally, because we’ve scaled the
business so significantly through both organic and inorganic growth, we’ve managed to achieve significant scale
efficiency in our R&D investments.

_Support Full-Stack Modernization and Tap into Multiple Budget Pools_

We provide a full-stack of infrastructure, application, and data modernization solutions, allowing companies to
integrate legacy and distributed systems with modern cloud capabilities. This full-stack of IT system modernization
solutions allows us to tap into multiple budget pools, including those covered by the CIO, Chief Data Officer, Head
of Applications, Chief Information Security Officer, Head of Infrastructure and more. With our suite of products and
solutions, we can help companies ensure that their existing infrastructure is able to successfully deliver digital
transformation initiatives and provide competitive advantages; deliver new mission-critical applications across hybrid
infrastructures; govern and access key data and content to strengthen customer relationships and ensure compliance;
and drive key initiatives to secure and protect data across the broader enterprise. This multi-layered approach opens
corporate budgets beyond the mainframe and infrastructure-centric buyer and expands our wallet share to larger digital
transformation initiatives that we can access through upsell and cross-sell opportunities.

_Maintain Our Strong Operational Efficiency and Profitability_

Our focus on operational efficiency and disciplined expense management has helped us to maintain consistently high
Adjusted EBITDA margins. This commitment to cost control has enabled our ongoing investments in R&D to further
expand our solution footprint. We believe this continued emphasis on cost control results in attractive operating
leverage and cash flow generation.


-----

_Pursue Accretive Acquisitions to Further Supplement Our Portfolio_

Over our history, we have completed more than 50 acquisitions and developed a track record of successfully
integrating acquired companies. Acquisitions have historically been completed at attractive multiples and have
allowed us to further enhance our product portfolio. Our multi-prong approach to evaluating potential acquisitions
includes identification of (1) Solution Enhancement, (2) Solution Expansion and (3) Synergy Realization, which
allows us to be intentional and methodical throughout both the discovery and vetting processes. We focus on
opportunities that accelerate the development of important underinvested functionalities, provide cross-selling
opportunities, and rationalize costs through scale.

**Our Industry**

We view our business as having three distinct addressable markets, each of which is aligned with a specific business
unit. While these markets are distinct in nature, there is a common thread in that the environment and underlying
technology are deeply embedded and responsible for organizations’ most mission-critical functions. We expect the
AMC Acquisition to further build out our product capabilities to address all customer use cases, and we will integrate
the AMC business’s products into our existing business units. While investment in legacy systems has been stable,
companies are increasing their spend across modernization, integration, hybridization and next-generation data
applications. We are positioned to serve as a modernization partner that taps into growing budget pools focused on
digital transformation across a suite of buyers with evergreen budget pools including the CIO, Chief Data Officer,
Head of Applications and Head of Infrastructure. In aggregate, we view our current total addressable market as $24
billion, which sits within a broader $3.9 trillion digital transformation market. Our three current addressable markets
are as follows:

  - _Mainframe and Hybrid Cloud Software: Our infrastructure modernization products support customers in_
optimizing their mainframe workloads across a broad spectrum of pathways. Based on third-party market
research, we estimate the current market related to mainframe and hybrid cloud software to be approximately
$11 billion. Going forward, this market is expected to grow at approximately 4% annually. We believe we
have an approximately 4% market share of this addressable market. For most of our customers, the embedded
nature of mainframe servers and the speed, size and security requirements of the workloads being run on
them make switching away from the mainframe an expensive and difficult process. The importance of
mainframe is evidenced by the fact that approximately 70% of the world’s production IT workloads are
handled by mainframes. According to IBM, over $8 trillion in payments per year, and over 30 billion
transactions per day, are processed by mainframes. Mainframe criticality is driven by the need for reliability,
with many applications requiring high availability, and the complexity and vastness of the underlying code
makes mainframe integral to operations. There are a range of advantages that mainframe offers over
distributed computing including reliability, speed of computing and security. For customers who remain on
the mainframe, the increased data requirements and volumes generated by the digitalization of businesses
will lead to increasing mainframe workloads. For example, when retail bank account holders check their
account or engage in online banking, this activity results in queries to the mainframe creating additional
mainframe transaction volume. As retail banks and other institutions increase their product offerings and
continue their digital transformation initiatives, the ability to connect and interact with the mainframe will be
an important component of most IT deployments. Higher workload volume combined with the ongoing need
to operate, optimize, and modernize the mainframe should provide continued growth opportunities within
our Infrastructure Modernization business unit.

We expect the AMC Acquisition to expand our product offerings in the mainframe and hybrid cloud market
with Enterprise Suite, COBOL and Mainframe ADLM, enabling further modernization of mainframe
applications and hybrid cloud infrastructure. With the largest companies in the world across every major
industry vertical continuing to leverage mainframe technology through hybrid cloud models, we expect that
hybrid infrastructure will remain the architecture of choice. By enabling core IT infrastructure to continue
living in mainframe environments while leveraging APIs that provide teams and customers with access to
cloud solutions and web and mobile applications, businesses are providing a modern experience for
employees and end-users, without taking on additional risk.


-----

  - _Enterprise Content Management: Data modernization solutions enable organizations to capture, build,_
organize, manage and store enterprise documents and records. Using third-party market research, we estimate
the current market related to ECM solutions to be approximately $5 billion. Going forward, this market is
forecasted to grow at approximately 6% annually. Enterprises need to securely manage documents and
records across their organization and require software that provides tools to capture, build, organize, manage
and store documents and records as they flow through business processes. ECM modernization tools for
mainframe-based enterprises allow organizations to utilize terabytes of stored data that are typically
inaccessible and unutilized. Common applications of ECM systems for our customers involve document
generation workloads, which include invoice and statement generation and ticket issuance. More advanced
processes include document ingestion, robotic process automation and workflow management. For example,
processing a mortgage application is a complex process involving multiple steps and systems, which can be
streamlined and automated with an ECM system. ECM solutions are often embedded in core customer facing
workflows and are integrated with other core IT systems (enterprise resource planning systems, customer
relationship management systems, financial systems, etc.) that leverage other mainframe-stored content. The
critical nature and deep integration of ECM workflows should continue to drive future growth within our
Data Modernization business unit.

  - _App Development & Testing: Our application modernization solutions enable organizations to extract data_
from legacy Unix/Power Systems, modernize the experience for users and enable the usability of large scale
non-relational databases. Based on third-party market research, we estimate the current market related to
application development and testing to be approximately $8 billion. Going forward, this market is forecasted
to grow by approximately 5% annually. Organizations use application modernization products to improve
application responsiveness and engagement across hybrid environments by creating modern workflows for
legacy applications in a safe and secure way. Common uses of application modernization products include
enabling application development on top of mission-critical non-relational databases, removing complexity
from building modern apps on legacy platforms with low- or no-code solutions and supporting agile DevOps
methods across multiple legacy coding environments. Continued investment in functionality that supports
cloud and containerized app deployments, organizations improving application UI/UX and a shift to low- or
no-code development concepts should provide continued growth opportunities within our Application
Modernization business unit. The AMC business’s Host Connectivity and CORBA segments offer
complementary modernization solutions enabling Rocket to provide a more comprehensive solution to our
customers and increase our share in the application and development testing market.

**Our Competition**

The market for our products and solutions is intensely competitive, subject to rapid change, and significantly affected
by new product introductions and other market activities of industry participants. We face direct and indirect
competition from a broad range of competitors who offer a variety of products and solutions to our current and
potential customers.

Competition among product providers in this market generally focuses on:

    - product features, functionality, performance and price;

    - cost containment;

    - ease of integration and speed of implementation;

    - company stability, resources and reputation;

    - level of customer service; and

    - new product and technology introductions.


-----

We believe our primary competitive advantages in this market are our:

    - diversified base of long-standing customers;

    - innovative and effective research and development organization;

    - unique and differentiated partnership with IBM;

    - highly visible and predictable revenue model;

    - strong Free Cash Flow generation; and

    - experienced, founder-led management team.

Our most frequently encountered competitors are BMC Software, Fortra and Broadcom.

It is also possible that we will face competition from new industry participants or alternative technologies. Moreover,
as the market for application infrastructure and tools, database tools suite, data management and analytics and storage
and security develops, a number of companies with significantly greater resources than we have could attempt to enter
or increase their presence in our industry, either independently or by acquiring or forming strategic alliances with our
competitors, or otherwise increase their focus on the industry. In addition, current and potential competitors have
established or may establish cooperative relationships among themselves or with third parties to increase the ability
of their products to address the needs of our current and potential customers.

**Research and Development**

We believe that our future success depends in part on our ability to maintain and improve our core technologies,
enhance our existing products, and develop new products that meet an expanding range of customer requirements.

We have a differentiated research and development philosophy resulting in world-class revenue retention rates while
leveraging a highly cost-efficient global platform. We have a team of 2,276 “Rocketeers,” of which approximately
63% are engineers. We go to market through dedicated enterprise sales, inside sales and renewals teams as well as
channel partners.

Our research and development model is based on the following key principles:

    - **_Customer-centric approach: customer pain points identified by sales and customer success teams drive_**
product investments that will meet customers’ greatest needs.

    - **_Agile organization: proactively address new technology/customer trends, leveraging existing source_**
code, moving from closed to open architectures and frameworks.

    - **_Strong partnership with IBM: deep insights into IBM’s mainframe roadmap and collaborative_**
development opportunities ensure Rocket’s continued technical leadership.

    - **_Commitment and priority: approximately 63% of Rocketeers are software engineers who work in a_**
highly collaborative culture which values teamwork, creativity and innovation.

personnel, new product development, frequent product enhancements, name recognition, and reliable product


-----

maintenance are essential to establishing and maintaining a technological leadership position. There can be no
assurance that our means of protecting our intellectual property in the U.S. or abroad will be adequate. We seek to

The following is a brief biography of each executive officer and director.

**Milan Shetti, President, Chief Executive Officer and member of Rocket’s board of directors, joined Rocket in 2020.**
Prior to joining Rocket, Mr. Shetti held various senior executive leadership positions at Hewlett Packard Enterprise
from 2009 to 2020, both as a business leader and technologist. At HPE, Mr. Shetti was most recently the Senior Vice
President and General Manager of the Storage and Big Data Business Unit and was previously Chief Technology
Officer for HPE’s Datacenter Infrastructure group. Prior to HPE, Mr. Shetti served as Technology Board Advisor for
Hedvig from 2017 to 2019. Mr. Shetti was the President and CEO of IBRIX Inc. from 2008 to 2009 prior to its
acquisition by HPE. Mr. Shetti started his career at Sun Microsystems as a software developer in 2000, and advanced
through a technical career path to Technical Director where he remained until 2006. Mr. Shetti holds a PhD in
Computer Science at University of Minnesota and a Master of Science in Computer Engineering from Syracuse
University.

**Darlene Williams, Chief Information Officer, joined Rocket in 2022. Ms. Williams brings over 20 years of IT**
experience. Prior to joining Rocket, Ms. Williams was the Operational Excellence Principal at Arisma Solutions from
2020 to 2022. Ms. Williams previously worked at American Water from 2008 to 2020, serving as the president of
Tennessee American Water from 2019 to 2020. Ms. Williams earned a Master of Business Administration at Nova
Southeastern University and a Bachelor of Science in Business Marketing from Florida State University.

**Bruce Bowden, Chief Financial Officer and member of Rocket’s board of directors, joined Rocket in 2022, bringing**
25 years of experience to the role. Prior to joining Rocket, Mr. Bowden was chief financial officer of AI provider,
Bottomline Technologies from 2021 to 2022 and chief financial officer of Interactions LLC from 2018 to 2021. From
2010 to 2017, Mr. Bowden served in multiple capacities at Nuance Communications, including as chief transformation
officer from 2016 to 2017. Mr. Bowden earned his Bachelor of Science in Business Administration in Finance and

**Senior Secured Credit Facilities**

On November 28, 2018, the Company entered into a credit facility with a syndicate of lenders that was amended by
that certain (i) Amendment No. 1, dated as of February 2, 2021, (ii) Amendment No. 2 and Joinder Agreement, dated
as of May 20, 2021, (iii) Amendment No. 3, dated as of June 28, 2021, (iv) Amendment No. 4, dated as of August 6,
2021, (v) Amendment No. 5 and Second Joinder Agreement, dated as of August 15, 2022, (vi) Amendment No. 6,
dated as of December 22, 2022, (vii) Amendment No. 7, dated as of June 1, 2023, and (viii) Amendment No. 8, dated
as of October 5, 2023. The Senior Secured Credit Facilities are comprised of the Existing First Lien Term Loans,
which includes a first lien term loan consisting of the Existing Dollar Term Loan, an aggregate principal amount of
approximately $1,410 million in U.S. dollar-denominated term loans, and the Existing Euro Term Loan, an aggregate
principal amount of €575 million in Euro-denominated term loans (after giving effect to amortization payments made
prior to the date hereof), each maturing on November 28, 2028, and the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility,
a revolving loan facility in an aggregate principal amount of up to approximately $152.9 million maturing on
November 28, 2026. On or around the date of issuance of the notes offered hereby, we intend to amend certain terms
of the Senior Secured Credit Facilities to, among other things, (v) increase the aggregate principal amount of
commitments under the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility by approximately $222 million to approximately
$375 million, (w) extend the maturity date of certain of the revolving commitments under the Existing First Lien
Revolving Credit Facility from November 28, 2026 to August 29, 2028, (x) increase the applicable margin for adjusted
SOFR to 4.00%, (y) increase the first lien net leverage ratio financial covenant to an amount not to exceed 8.00 to
1.00 and (z) add requirements for certain of our subsidiaries incorporated under the laws of England and Wales to
guarantee and secure the obligations under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities.

On or around the date of issuance of the notes offered hereby, we intend to enter into the Euro Incremental Term Loan
Facility under the credit agreement governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans and the USD Incremental Term
Loan Facility, either as a side car term loan facility or as an incremental term loan facility under the credit agreement
governing the Existing First Lien Term Loans, in a combined aggregate principal amount of $1,000 million (reflecting
U.S. dollar-equivalent for the Euro Incremental Term Loan Facility), in each case with a syndicate of lenders, that
will rank pari passu with the Existing First Lien Term Loans and which will mature on November 28, 2028.

The documentation for our Senior Secured Credit Facilities provides that we have the right at any time, subject to
customary conditions, to request incremental loans in an aggregate principal amount of up to (a) the greater of (1)
$175 million and (2) an amount equal to 65% of our trailing twelve-month consolidated EBITDA at the time of
determination on a pro forma basis, plus (b) an amount equal to all voluntary prepayments (including open market
purchases) of the Existing First Lien Term Loans and certain other debt (to the extent not funded with the proceeds of
long-term debt other than revolving loans), plus (c) an amount equal to all voluntary prepayments of any first lien
refinancing facilities or certain other refinancing debt, plus (d) an additional amount so long as we (I) in the case of
incremental debt that is secured by the collateral on a pari passu basis with our Senior Secured Credit Facilities, do
not exceed a specified pro forma first lien net leverage ratio, (II) in the case of incremental debt that is secured by a
lien on the collateral junior to the liens securing our Senior Secured Credit Facilities, do not exceed a specified pro
forma secured net leverage ratio and (III) in the case of unsecured incremental debt or incremental debt secured solely
by assets not constituting collateral, do not exceed a specified pro forma total net leverage ratio.

The interest rate for the Existing Dollar Term Loan is or will be, as applicable, at the Company’s election: (i) 3.75%,
plus “ABR” defined as the greatest of (a) the Federal Funds Effective Rate plus 0.50%, (b) the prime lending rate in
effect on such day, and (c) Term SOFR applicable for an interest period of one month commencing on such day plus
1.0%; or (ii) 4.75% plus Term SOFR, which is subject to a 0.50% Term SOFR floor and Term SOFR adjustment. The
interest rate for the Existing Euro Term Loan is: (i) 4.75%, plus “Adjusted EURIBOR Rate,” which is subject to a
0.00% floor. Interest payments are due either quarterly or on the last day of the applicable Interest Period for Term
SOFR Loans and Adjusted EURIBOR Rate Loans, no less frequently than quarterly. Principal payments of 1% per


-----

annum of the initial Existing First Lien Term Loans amounts are payable quarterly, with the remaining balance due at
the maturity date for the Existing First Lien Term Loans on November 28, 2028. The interest rate for the Incremental
First Lien Term Loan Facilities is expected to be Term SOFR, plus an applicable margin.

The Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility interest rate is, at the Company’s election, (i) 2.25% plus ABR, or
(ii) 3.25% plus SOFR with margin step-downs dependent on the Company’s first lien net leverage ratio as follows:
(a) if the first lien net leverage ratio is between 4.50 to 1.00 and 4.00 to 1.00 the ABR and SOFR margins are 2.125%
and 3.125%, respectively; and (b) if the first lien net leverage ratio is less than or equal to 4.00 to 1.00 the ABR and
SOFR margins are 2.00% and 3.00%, respectively. The maturity date of the Existing First Lien Revolving Credit
Facility is November 28, 2026.

The Existing First Lien Revolving Credit Facility’s capacity is reduced by the aggregated letters of credit outstanding,
which totaled $1.2 million as of December 31, 2023.

The Senior Secured Credit Facilities contain a financial covenant that applies solely with respect to the Existing First
Lien Revolving Credit Facility and requires a maximum first lien net leverage ratio of 7.70 to 1.00 if, on the last day
of any quarter, the principal amount of revolving credit loans then outstanding under the Existing First Lien Revolving
Credit Facility is greater than 35% of the aggregate outstanding revolving credit commitments.

The Senior Secured Credit Facilities are also subject to certain mandatory prepayment requirements, including, with
respect to the Existing First Lien Term Loans, 50% (with step-downs to 25% and 0% based on achieving certain first
lien net leverage ratios) of annual excess cash flow greater than $15 million in any fiscal year. The Senior Secured
Credit Facilities also contain quarterly and annual financial reporting requirements.

For further information, see _Note 10, Long-Term Debt to our audited consolidated financial statements included_
elsewhere in this offering memorandum.

**Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption**

This offering of the Notes may be consummated prior to the consummation of the AMC Acquisition. If the Issue Date
occurs prior to the Acquisition Date, the Company will enter into an escrow agreement (as amended, supplemented
or modified from time to time, the “Escrow Agreement”) on the Issue Date among the Company, the Trustee and
Wilmington Trust, National Association, as escrow agent (in such capacity, together with its successors, the “Escrow
Agent”), pursuant to which an amount equal to the gross proceeds of the offering of the Notes sold on the Issue Date
will be deposited into an escrow account (the “Escrow Account”). By its acceptance of the Notes, each Holder shall
be deemed to authorize and direct the Trustee to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under the Escrow
Agreement.

The Escrow Account will not include cash to fund any accrued and unpaid interest owing to Holders of the Notes,
which is included in the Special Mandatory Redemption Price. In the event that the Special Mandatory Price payable
upon such Special Mandatory Redemption for the Notes exceeds the amount of the applicable Escrowed Property, the
Company will be required to fund the difference between the applicable Special Mandatory Redemption Price and the
amount of the Escrowed Property, plus certain fees and expenses of the Trustee, Notes Collateral Agent and Escrow
Agent pursuant to a commitment provided by it.

The initial funds deposited in the Escrow Account, and all other funds, securities, interest, dividends, distributions and
other property and payments credited to the Escrow Account in connection with the Notes (less any property and/or
funds paid in accordance with the Escrow Agreement) are referred to, collectively, as the “Escrowed Property.” The
Escrowed Property will be controlled by the Escrow Agent, on behalf of the Trustee and the Holders of the Notes.
Interest will be calculated in accordance with the terms of the Indenture and the Notes.

The Escrow Agreement shall provide for the Escrow Agent to release a portion of the Escrowed Property in an amount
equal to the amount of accrued and unpaid interest from the Issue Date or the most recent interest payment date, as


-----

applicable, prior to the Escrow Release in order to satisfy the interest payment obligations in respect of the Notes
under the Indenture as set forth under “—Principal, Maturity and Interest.”

Other than in connection with the payment of a semi-annual interest payment as set forth under “—Principal, Maturity
and Interest” and pursuant to the previous paragraph, the Company will be entitled to cause the Escrow Agent to
release the Escrowed Property (in which case the Escrowed Property will be paid to, or as directed by, the Company)
(the “Escrow Release”) upon delivery to the Escrow Agent, on or prior to July 5, 2024 (such date the “Escrow Outside
_Date”), of an Officer’s Certificate (the “Escrow Release Officer’s Certificate”), upon which the Escrow Agent shall_
be entitled to rely absolutely without further investigation, to the effect that the AMC Acquisition will be consummated
substantially concurrently with or promptly following the Escrow Release.

The Escrow Release will occur promptly following the receipt by the Escrow Agent of the Escrow Release Officer’s
Certificate (the date of the Escrow Release, the “Escrow Release Date”). Upon the Escrow Release, the Escrowed
Property will be paid out of the Escrow Account in accordance with the Escrow Agreement and the Escrow Account
will be reduced to zero.

The Company will grant the Trustee, for its benefit and the benefit of the Holders, subject to certain liens of the Escrow
Agent, a first-priority security interest in the Escrow Account to secure the payment of the Special Mandatory
Redemption Price of the Notes; provided, however that such liens and security interest shall automatically be released
and terminate at such time as the Escrowed Property is released from the Escrow Account on the Escrow Release
Date. For the avoidance of doubt, such liens and security interests will be permitted under the Indenture. The Escrow
Agent will invest the Escrowed Property as directed by the Company in such short-term liquid investments (including
bank deposit products) as permitted under the Escrow Agreement, and liquidate such investments, as the Company
will from time to time direct in writing. In the absence of such investment direction, the Escrowed Property will remain
uninvested in cash.

In the event that (i) the Acquisition Date has not occurred on or prior to the Escrow Outside Date, (ii) the Company
notifies the Trustee in writing prior to the Escrow Outside Date that the Company will not pursue the consummation
of the AMC Acquisition or (iii) the Acquisition Agreement has been terminated prior to the Escrow Outside Date
without the consummation of the AMC Acquisition (the date of any such event being the “Special Termination Date”),
the Company will redeem the Notes (the “Special Mandatory Redemption”) at a price (the “Special Mandatory
_Redemption Price”) equal to 100% of the then outstanding aggregate principal amount of the Notes, plus accrued and_
unpaid interest on the Notes, if any, from the Issue Date, or the most recent date to which interest has been paid on
the Notes, whichever is later, to, but excluding, the Special Mandatory Redemption Date (as defined below).

Notice of the Special Mandatory Redemption will be delivered by the Company no later than one Business Day
following the Special Termination Date to the Trustee in accordance with the terms of the Escrow Agreement and the
Indenture and will provide that the Notes shall be redeemed on a date that is no later than the third Business Day after
such notice is given by the Company (the “Special Mandatory Redemption Date”) in accordance with the applicable
procedures of DTC. On or prior to the Special Mandatory Redemption Date, the Escrow Agent shall pay to the Paying
Agent for payment to each Holder of Notes the Special Mandatory Redemption Price for such Holder’s Notes.

**Guarantees**

From and after the Completion Date, the obligations of the Company under the Notes and the Indenture will be jointly
and severally, unconditionally guaranteed on a senior secured basis (the “Note Guarantees”) by each existing and
future (x) Wholly Owned Domestic Subsidiary that is a Restricted Subsidiary and (x) wholly owned Foreign
Subsidiary that is incorporated in a Covered Jurisdiction, in each case that Guarantees the Company’s obligations
under the Credit Agreements (the “Guarantors”). Following the Completion Date, Subsidiaries of the Company will
be required to Guarantee the Notes to the extent described in “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Guarantees.”

On a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, as of and for the year ended December 31, 2023, as
applicable, our non-guarantor subsidiaries would have had 4% of our total assets and would have generated 16% of
our pro forma revenues and 11% of our Pro Forma Run Rate Cash EBITDA (as defined in this offering memorandum).


-----

Each Note Guarantee will be limited to the maximum amount that would not render the Guarantor’s obligations subject
to avoidance under applicable law as a fraudulent conveyance, fraudulent transfer or unjust preference, including
provisions of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or any comparable provision of foreign or state law or provincial law to
comply with corporate benefit, financial assistance and other laws. By virtue of this limitation, a Guarantor’s
obligation under its Note Guarantee could be significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Notes, or a
Guarantor may have effectively no obligation under its Note Guarantee. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the
Notes—A court could cancel the notes, the related guarantees or the liens securing the notes and/or the guarantees
under fraudulent transfer laws.”

The Note Guarantee of a Guarantor will be automatically and unconditionally released and discharged upon:

(1) a sale, exchange, transfer or other disposition (including by way of merger, amalgamation,
consolidation, dividend, distribution or otherwise) of the Capital Stock of such Guarantor or the
sale, exchange, transfer or other disposition, of all or substantially all of the assets of the Guarantor,
in each case, to a Person other than to the Company or a Restricted Subsidiary and as otherwise not
prohibited by the Indenture;

(2) the designation in accordance with the Indenture of the Guarantor as an Unrestricted Subsidiary or
the occurrence of any event after which the Guarantor is no longer a Restricted Subsidiary;

(3) defeasance or discharge of the Notes, as provided in “—Defeasance” and “—Satisfaction and
Discharge”;

(4) to the extent that such Guarantor is not an Immaterial Subsidiary solely due to the operation of
clause (i) of the definition of “Immaterial Subsidiary,” upon the release of the guarantee referred to
in such clause;

(5) such Guarantor being (or being substantially concurrently) released or discharged from all of its
obligations under all of its Guarantees of payment (i) by the Company of any Indebtedness of the
Company under the Credit Agreements or (ii) in the case of a Note Guarantee made by a Guarantor
(each, an “Other Guarantee”) as a result of its guarantee of other Indebtedness of the Company or
a Guarantor pursuant to the covenant entitled “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Guarantees,”
by the Company or the applicable Guarantor of the relevant Indebtedness, except in the case of (i)
or (ii), a release as a result of payment under such Guarantee (it being understood that a release
subject to a contingent reinstatement is still considered a release);

(6) upon the merger, amalgamation or consolidation of any Guarantor with and into the Company or
another Guarantor or upon the liquidation of such Guarantor, in each case, in compliance with the
applicable provisions of the Indenture;

(7) upon the achievement of Investment Grade Status by the Notes; provided that such Note Guarantee
shall be reinstated upon the Reversion Date; and

(8) as described under “—Amendments and Waivers” or in accordance with the provisions of the First
Lien Intercreditor Agreement.

Claims of creditors of Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries, including trade creditors, secured creditors and creditors holding
debt and guarantees issued by those Subsidiaries, and claims of preferred and minority stockholders (if any) of those
Subsidiaries and claims against joint ventures generally will have priority with respect to the assets and earnings of
those Subsidiaries and joint ventures over the claims of creditors of the Company, including Holders. The Notes and
each Note Guarantee therefore will be structurally subordinated to creditors (including trade creditors) and preferred
and minority stockholders (if any) of Subsidiaries of the Company (other than the Guarantors) and joint ventures.
Although the Indenture will limit the incurrence of Indebtedness, Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock of Restricted
Subsidiaries, the limitation will be subject to a number of significant exceptions.


-----

Moreover, the Indenture will not impose any limitation on the incurrence by Restricted Subsidiaries of liabilities that
are not considered Indebtedness, Disqualified Stock or Preferred Stock under the Indenture. See “—Certain
Covenants—Limitation on Indebtedness.”

**Security for the Notes**

**_Collateral Generally_**

If the Issue Date occurs prior to the Acquisition Date, the Notes will be secured only by a first-priority security interest
in the Escrow Account and all funds on deposit therein.

From and after the Completion Date, the Notes and the Guarantees thereof will be secured on a pari passu basis with
the First Lien Credit Agreement Obligations and the Term Loan Credit Agreement Obligations by perfected firstpriority security interests in the same assets and property of the Company and the Guarantors and to the extent
constituting Collateral that secures the First Lien Credit Agreement Obligations and the Term Loan Credit Agreement
Obligations. The First Lien Secured Parties other than the Holders have rights and remedies with respect to the
Collateral that, if exercised, could also adversely affect the value of the Collateral benefiting the Holders, particularly
the rights described below under “First Lien Intercreditor Agreement.”

The Company and the Guarantors are and will be able to incur additional Indebtedness in the future which could share
in the Collateral, including Additional First Lien Obligations and other Obligations secured by Permitted Liens. With
respect to the Company and the Guarantors, the amount of such Additional First Lien Obligations and such additional
Obligations will be limited by the covenants described under “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Indebtedness”
and “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Liens.” Under certain circumstances, the amount of any such Additional
First Lien Obligations and such additional Obligations could be significant. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the
Notes—The value of the collateral securing the notes and the related guarantees may not be sufficient to satisfy our
obligations under the notes.”

**_Certain Limitations on the Collateral_**

The Collateral granted by the Company and the Guarantors organized in the United States securing the Notes will not
include any of the following assets, unless otherwise elected by the Company in its sole discretion (the “Excluded
_Property”):_

(i) any property of the Company or a Guarantor with respect to which the creation of a security
interest or Lien by the Company or such Guarantor pursuant to the Notes Security Agreement or any other Notes

(ii) any vehicles, airplanes and other assets subject to certificates of title;

(iii) letter-of-credit rights except to the extent constituting supporting obligations;

(iv) any property subject to a purchase money agreement, capital lease or similar arrangement
permitted under the Indenture to the extent the creation of a security interest therein is prohibited thereby or creates a

than the Company, any Guarantor or any other Restricted Subsidiary);

(v) (x) all leasehold interests in real property (including, for the avoidance of doubt, any requirement
to obtain any landlord or other third party waivers, estoppels, consents or collateral access letters in respect of such

(vi) any “intent to use” Trademark application filed in the United States Patent and Trademark Office
unless and until an amendment to allege use or a statement of use has been filed with, and accepted by, the United


-----

States Patent and Trademark Office to the extent, if any, that and solely during the period, if any, in which the grant

(vii) any charter, permit, franchise, authorization, lease, license or agreement (and the assets subject
thereto at the time of the acquisition of such assets), in each case, only to the extent that the grant of a security

or (y) would give any party (other than the Company, a Guarantor or other subsidiary of the Company) to any such

(viii) any commercial tort claim with a claim value of less than $20,000,000;

(ix) any Excluded Stock and Stock Equivalents;

(x) any assets with respect to which, the Company and the First Lien Credit Agreement Collateral
Agent reasonably determine the burden or cost (including adverse tax, regulatory, accounting or other consequences

(xi) any property of the Company or a Guarantor with respect to which the creation of a security
interest or lien therein by the Company or such Guarantor pursuant to the Notes Security Agreement or any other

(xiv) any property or assets with respect to which granting a security interest in such assets is prohibited

Commercial Code or other applicable law;

provided that with respect to clauses (vii) and (xiv), such property shall be Excluded Property only to the extent and

that proceeds of and products from any and all of the foregoing that would otherwise constitute Excluded Property

otherwise constitute Excluded Property shall be considered Collateral; provided, further, that in no event shall any

(vi) no landlord waivers, collateral access agreements, bailee waivers or other similar agreements with

(vii) no notice to obtain the consent of any governmental authority under the Federal Assignment of

(viii) there shall be no requirement to enter into any source code escrow arrangement (or any obligation

**_After-Acquired Collateral_**

-----

Document (excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, any Excluded Property or assets not required to be Collateral

Document to vest in the Notes Collateral Agent a first-priority perfected security interest (subject to Permitted Liens)
in such after-acquired collateral and to take such actions to add such after-acquired collateral to the Collateral, and
thereupon all provisions of the Indenture and the Notes Collateral Documents relating to the Collateral shall be deemed

Agent a perfected security interest in after-acquired collateral owned by the Company or such Guarantors.

On or following the Completion Date and subject to the terms of the Indenture and the Notes Collateral Documents,
the Company and the Guarantors shall execute any and all further documents, financing statements (including

the validity and priority (subject to Permitted Liens) of the security interests created or intended to be created by the
